title.narrative: Conflict Justice and Reconciliation Approaches for Durable Peacemaking

description.narrative: The Conflict Justice and Reconciliation programme seeks to enhance the prospect that peace settlements succeed by identifying key rights-based issues which are a priority for important segments of the population and tailors ways for peacemaking efforts to address them promptly. It mobilises human rights and conflict resolution expertise to engage with a broad range of stakeholders, from local communities to Track 1 actors. The programme focusses on Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan and Yemen. In addition, the programme includes a scoping component for opportunities in relation to countries and conflict contexts which are not included in the core proposal.

mailing-address.narrative: Rue des Deux Églises 25, 1000 Saint-Josse-ten-Noode, Belgium

CJR I - Outcome 1: Strengthened the engagement of Iraqi government in the development of a realistic and implementable strategy towards ISIS families in Iraq

1. Sustained and serious Iraqi government stakeholder engagement with the issue of ISIS families, specific references made to the issue 2. Iraqi government representatives' engagement with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders in the process of policy development 3. Iraqi government bodies developing a realistic and implementable strategy for the disengagement and de-radicalization of ISIS families 4. Iraqi government representatives identifying and pursuing steps towards implementation of policy
